item.title: Pending Code Reviews Are Blockers for Your Team 🚧
item.author: iam2kabhishek@gmail.com (2KAbhishek)
item.description:

Long delays in code reviews can cause several issues:

item.title: Do Not Parse ls! (Use this instead) ❌📂
item.author: iam2kabhishek@gmail.com (2KAbhishek)
item.description:
TLDR

ls parsing bad, do this

ls -1iq | grep -o '^ *[0-9]*' # get file inodes
find /path/to/search -inum <inode_number> # convert inodes to file info

You can continue your doomscroll now 👍🏼

You still here? (thanks!! 😇) ok, then read on:

Do you know why its not recommended to parse ls output for operation on a list of files? It’s because the UNIX system allows any characters in filenames so things like newline, whitespaces, ~ (and a lot more weird chars) are all valid.

item.title: Remove Screen Flickering OBS 💻📹
item.author: iam2kabhishek@gmail.com (2KAbhishek)
item.description:
I was recently trying out OBS for my new YouTube Channel! but faced weird flickering issues when recording, after a lot of tweaking I found the solution.

You have to turn of Vsync on your system.

On KDE the steps are as follows:

  1. Open System Settings
  2. Then go to Display and Monitor section
  3. Click on Compositor
  4. Here, change Tearing Prevention (vsync) to Never

This should do the trick. Try again, and you shouldn’t face flickering issues anymore.
